answers.answer: Eat low sugar. Maybe just some egg whites
Depends if it's the one hour or the three hours

Your doctor should have told you when to not eat anything, but it is safest to not eat anything at all until you are all done with it. Don't want to risk having gestational diabetes and not catching it! Good luck!
They told me I could eat before mine... mine was around the same time and there's no way I could make it that long without eating. I would call your doctor first thing in the morning and ask.
I've heard that different practitioners have different criteria but when I took my test I was supposed to fast for 12 hours beforehand and have only the glucola drink.

I was told not to fast and that I could eat whatever I wanted before the test, I was given a drink and when the test results came back everything was normal. But I guess it depends on you doctor because mine specifically said not to fast at all.
Yea my doctor said I could eat before the test but wasnt specific
I had the one hour test & was told not to eat or drink anything with sugar.
It's a fasting test, I wouldn't recommend eating before hand unless it's protein only.
If your doctor told you to eat then eat like you normally do. If he didn't want you to eat something specific then he would have told you.

I only had the one hour test and wasn't told not to eat or if I could eat, I ended up not eating and almost passing out 55 minutes after drinking the drink they gave me. maybe you can call in the morning and ask just to be safe

I ate beforr and then it came back that I had to do the 3 hr and the 3 hr I didn't eat and came back normal. So I wld suggest just dont eat anything with sugar maybe eat some crackers or eggs before if u need to eat and u shld be just fine!:)
My doctor said I could eat but I didn't and passed. I know some ladies who ate before the 1 hour failed. So I decided to skip breakfast and did very well :)
Thanks ladies I think ill just wait to eat till after the test

I ate a bowl of cereal before the one hour test and passed just fine. @monikacortez if your doctor said you can eat you can eat. I know the 3 hour test for sure you're not suppose to eat. The one hour test is up to your doctor. I personally can not go more than 30 min after waking up without eating, but I'm a huge breakfast eater. Best of luck with your test.
I was told I could eat a light meal with low carbs and low sugar for the one hour test.

Eat an egg on toast. You don't wanna eat anything with a lot of natural sugars or artificial sugars. Knew a couple of people that were diagnosed with gestational diabetes because they had a bowl of coco puffs before the test.

question: I have my glucose test tomorrow at 9:30am what can I eat before it and still pass?? Or should I just not eat anything till after???
title: glucose test!
